snippet: Mr. Naughton was a writer, mentor and irrepressible prankster whose career took him to The New York Times, The Philadelphia Inquirer and a leading journalism institute.
abstract: James M Naughton, White House and national correspondent for The New York Times during the Nixon, Ford and Carer administrations, dies at age 73.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Naughton was a writer, mentor and irrepressible prankster whose career took him to The New York Times, The Philadelphia Inquirer and a leading journalism institute.

headline.seo: James M. Naughton, Reporter and Editor, Dies at 73
headline.main: James Naughton, Newsman and Puckish Inspiration, Dies at 73
headline.print_headline: James Naughton, 73, Editor, Reporter and Puckish Muse
